snippet: A plan to combine the two biggest museums in Los Angeles has both wide support and a powerful potential foe: a philanthropist who bailed one of them out five years ago.
abstract: Plan to combine Museum of Contemporary Art and Los Angeles County Museum of Art has both wide support and powerful potential foe, philanthropist Eli Broad, who donated $16 million to bail out MOCA five years ago with provision that it not merge with any museum within 100 miles of its downtown flagship.

byline.contributor: Patricia Cohen and Carol Vogel contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: A plan to combine the two biggest museums in Los Angeles has both wide support and a powerful potential foe: a philanthropist who bailed one of them out five years ago.

headline.main: Cautious Approval for a Plan to Merge a City’s Museums
headline.print_headline: Cautious Approval For a Plan to Merge A City’s Museums
